meanings.definition: The state or quality of being stuffy.
meanings.sent1: The stuffiness of the room made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: I opened the window to alleviate the stuffiness in the office.
meanings.sent3: The stuffiness of the classroom made the students doze off during the lecture.
meanings.sent4: The stuffiness of the attic was like a heavy blanket weighing down on us.
meanings.sent5: The stuffiness of the small elevator was suffocating.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being uncomfortably warm and lacking fresh air.
meanings.sent1: She complained about the stuffiness of the crowded bus.
meanings.sent2: The stuffiness of the gym made it hard to exercise comfortably.
meanings.sent3: The stuffiness of the sauna made us all sweat profusely.
meanings.sent4: The stuffiness of the car on a hot day was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The stuffiness of the room made everyone long for a cool breeze.

meanings.definition: The quality of being overly formal or conservative.
meanings.sent1: The stuffiness of the event made me feel out of place.
meanings.sent2: His stuffiness in adhering to tradition was evident in his attire.
meanings.sent3: The stuffiness of the meeting made it hard to relax and be oneself.
meanings.sent4: The stuffiness of the dress code made her opt for a more casual outfit.
meanings.sent5: The stuffiness of the rules stifled creativity in the workplace.
